prayers.title: The Our Father
prayers.subtitle: The Lord's Prayer
prayers.text:
Our Father, who art in heaven,
hallowed be thy name.
Thy kingdom come,
thy will be done,
on earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread,
and forgive us our trespasses,
as we forgive those who trespass against us.
And lead us not into temptation,
but deliver us from evil.
Amen.
prayers.source: Gospel of Matthew 6:9-13, Gospel of Luke 11:2-4

scriptureReferences.text: Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name...

prayers.instructions: Pray slowly and meditatively, considering each petition.
reflectionPrompts: What does it mean to call God 'Father'?
How do we forgive those who have hurt us?
What does 'thy will be done' mean in daily life?

prayers.title: The Hail Mary
prayers.subtitle: Prayer to Our Lady
prayers.text:
Hail Mary, full of grace,
the Lord is with thee.
Blessed art thou amongst women,
and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus.
Holy Mary, Mother of God,
pray for us sinners,
now and at the hour of our death.
Amen.

scriptureReferences.text: Hail, full of grace, the Lord is with you!

prayers.instructions: Often prayed as part of the Rosary. Meditate on Mary's role in salvation.
reflectionPrompts: How does Mary's 'yes' to God inspire our own faithfulness?
What does it mean to ask for Mary's intercession?

prayers.title: Glory Be to the Father
prayers.subtitle: Doxology
prayers.text:
Glory be to the Father,
and to the Son,
and to the Holy Spirit.
As it was in the beginning,
is now, and ever shall be,
world without end.
Amen.
prayers.instructions: A prayer of praise to the Trinity, often used to conclude other prayers.
reflectionPrompts: How does this prayer honor each Person of the Trinity?
What does 'world without end' mean to you?

prayers.title: Morning Offering
prayers.subtitle: Offering the Day to God
prayers.text:
O Jesus, through the Immaculate Heart of Mary,
I offer You my prayers, works, joys and sufferings
of this day in union with the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass
throughout the world.
I offer them for all the intentions
of Your Sacred Heart:
the salvation of souls,
reparation for sin,
the reunion of all Christians.
I offer them for the intentions
of our bishops and of all Apostles of Prayer,
and in particular for those recommended
by our Holy Father this month.
Amen.
prayers.instructions: Pray upon waking to offer your entire day to God.
reflectionPrompts: How can I offer my work today to God?
What sufferings can I unite to Christ's passion?

prayers.title: Angel of God
prayers.subtitle: Prayer to Guardian Angel
prayers.text:
Angel of God,
my guardian dear,
to whom God's love
commits me here,
ever this day
be at my side,
to light and guard,
to rule and guide.
Amen.
prayers.instructions: A prayer asking for the protection and guidance of your guardian angel.
reflectionPrompts: How does your guardian angel guide you?
When have you felt angelic protection in your life?

prayers.title: Act of Contrition
prayers.subtitle: Prayer of Repentance
prayers.text:
My God,
I am sorry for my sins with all my heart.
In choosing to do wrong
and failing to do good,
I have sinned against you
whom I should love above all things.
I firmly intend, with your help,
to do penance,
to sin no more,
and to avoid whatever leads me to sin.
Our Savior Jesus Christ
suffered and died for us.
In his name, my God, have mercy.
Amen.
prayers.instructions: Pray with sincere sorrow for sins, especially before or after Confession.
reflectionPrompts: What sins weigh most heavily on my heart?
How can I avoid occasions of sin in the future?
How does God's mercy transform my heart?

prayers.title: Come, Holy Spirit
prayers.subtitle: Invocation of the Holy Spirit
prayers.text:
Come, Holy Spirit,
fill the hearts of your faithful
and kindle in them the fire of your love.
Send forth your Spirit
and they shall be created.
And You shall renew
the face of the earth.

O, God, who by the light of the Holy Spirit,
did instruct the hearts of the faithful,
grant that by the same Holy Spirit
we may be truly wise
and ever enjoy His consolations.
Through Christ Our Lord.
Amen.
prayers.instructions: Pray when seeking the Holy Spirit's guidance and strength.
reflectionPrompts: How does the Holy Spirit guide my decisions?
What gifts of the Spirit do I need most?
How can I be more open to the Spirit's promptings?

prayerIntentions.title: For Our Parish Families
prayerIntentions.description: That families in our parish may grow in faith and love

prayerIntentions.title: For the Sick of Our Parish
prayerIntentions.description: That those who are ill may find healing and comfort

contentConnections.description: The Our Father connects to understanding our relationship with God as Father

Understanding the gifts of the Holy Spirit enhances this prayer
